sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词都有"差别，区别"之意。
means: difference ： 普通用词，可指事物本质上的差异或数量上的差额，也可指事物在某一方面的差别，还可指人们之间的不同意见。
distinction ： 较正式用词，除指事物在本质上的差别外，还指在某一方面或某一细节上的区分，要在认真观察、研究后才易觉察。
discrepancy ： 多用于言论和记述方面，指两物之间缺乏使之相似或平衡的协调。
discrimination ： 侧重指在判断、见识方面的差别，也可指待遇上的区别。

sentence.Network_en: Lewis emerges as a composer of distinction and sensitivity.
sentence.Network_cn: 刘易斯作为一位悟性很高的优秀作曲家崭露头角。

sentence.Network_en: Steve Crabb can fly the flag with distinction for Britain in Barcelona.
sentence.Network_cn: 史蒂夫·克拉布在巴塞罗那可以旗帜鲜明地支持英国。

sentence.Network_en: Many people make a sharp distinction between humans and other animals.
sentence.Network_cn: 很多人认为人类和其他动物截然不同。

jx.jx_en_mean: an artificially created distinction where no real difference exists

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'subdivision, category'): via Old French from Latin distinctio(n-), from the verb distinguere (see distinguish)

entry.def: A distinction between similar things is a difference.

example.ex: There are obvious distinctions between the two wine-making areas...
example.tran: 两个酿酒地区之间有着显著的差别。

example.ex: The distinction between craft and fine art is more controversial.
example.tran: 对手工艺和美术之间的差别争议更大。

entry.def: Distinction is the quality of being very good or better than other things of the same type.

example.ex: Lewis emerges as a composer of distinction and sensitivity.
example.tran: 刘易斯作为一位悟性很高的优秀作曲家崭露头角。

entry.def: A distinction is a special award or honour that is given to someone because of their very high level of achievement.

example.ex: The order was created in 1902 as a special distinction for eminent men and women...
example.tran: 该勋位设立于1902年，作为一项殊荣授予杰出的男性和女性。

example.ex: I did an M.A. at Liverpool University in Latin American Studies and got a distinction.
example.tran: 我在利物浦大学以优异成绩获得了拉丁美洲研究方向的硕士学位。

entry.def: If you say that someone or something has the distinction of being something, you are drawing attention to the fact that they have the special quality of being that thing. Distinction is normally used to refer to good qualities, but can sometimes also be used to refer to bad qualities.

example.ex: He has the distinction of being regarded as the Federal Republic's greatest living writer.
example.tran: 他才华横溢，被誉为联邦共和国目前尚在世的最伟大的作家。

means.word_mean: 1. a discrimination between things as different and distinct;

sentences.sentence: "it is necessary to make a distinction between love and infatuation"

means.word_mean: 2. high status importance owing to marked superiority;

sentences.sentence: "it has the distinction of being the cheapest restaurant in town"
"he learned the distinction between gold and lead"

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =prick,表示"刺,刺激"; 2. 引申为火焰

stems_affixes.value_cn: 清楚的,明显的;[from]截然不同的
stems_affixes.word_buile: dis分开+stinct刺,刺激→把刺分开→明显的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 特别的;有特色的;与众不同的
stems_affixes.word_buile: distinct[adj.清楚的,明显的;[from]截然不同的]+ive表形容词→adj.特别的;有特色的;与众不同的
instinct[n.本能,直觉,天性]+ive表形容词→adj.本能的
distinct清楚的,明显的+ly表副词→adv.清楚地, 显然

stems_affixes.value_cn: 区别,差别;级别;特性;声望;显赫
stems_affixes.word_buile: distinct[adj.清楚的,明显的;[from]截然不同的]+ion表名词→n.区别,差别;级别;特性;声望;显赫
in内+stinct刺,刺激→内在的刺激,本能
in内+stig=stinct刺,刺激+ate使……→刺激别人内部→煽动

Sentence.sentence: When a noted leader on the art of management, Peter Drucker, coined the phrase "Management is doing things right; leadership is doing the right things," he was seeking to clarify the distinctions he associates with the terms.
The example of Rembrandt's painting suggests that a distinction should be made between effort and accomplishment.
Last spring one of the two, Australia, gave up the dubious distinction by establishing paid family leave starting in

means.word_mean: 区别, 明显差别, 特征

sentences.en: I can't see any distinction between these two cases.
sentences.cn: 我看不出这两个案例有什么不同。

means.word_mean: 卓越, 优秀, 盛名

sentences.en: He is a writer of real distinction.
sentences.cn: 他是一位真正才智超群的作家。

means.word_mean: 荣誉, 殊荣, 奖赏

sentences.en: These are the highest distinctions that have ever been given by our government.
sentences.cn: 这些是我国政府迄今授予的最高荣誉称号。

sentences.en: He has gained a distinction in various fields of scholarly studies.
sentences.cn: 他在多种科学的学术研究中享有盛名。

jushi.english: These are the highest distinctions that have ever been given by our government.
jushi.chinese: 这些是我国政府迄今授予的最高荣誉称号。

jushi.english: He was regarded as a man of distinction in his country.
jushi.chinese: 在他的国家里,他被看作是非凡的人。

jushi.english: He has gained a distinction in various fields of scholarly studies.
jushi.chinese: 他在多种科学的学术研究中享有盛名。
